title: Derby’s Take: New Research Faults Congress for Opening Door to Fed Activism
body:
Legislative imprecision has opened the door to the Federal Reserve straying beyond its legal mission in a way that could undermine the central bank’s powers over time, a new paper says.
In research to be published by the Duke Law Journal, University of Pennsylvania professor Christina Parajon Skinner writes that vague language in the law governing what the Fed can and cannot do opens the central bank up to pressure to go beyond what the law intends.
